alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 3:04AM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, strongest near Lake Superior. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Southern Lake and Carlton and South St. Louis Counties. In Wisconsin, Douglas County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecast snow amounts may still change. Keep up with the latest forecast and adjust travel plans accordingly. Blizzard conditions are possible Wednesday night into Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
